metadata.title: CVE-2024-32660 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol. Prior toversion 3.5.1, a malicious server can crash the FreeRDP client by sendinginvalid huge allocation size. Version 3.5.1 contains a patch for the issue.No known workarounds are available.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-32660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.7').
